website_summaries.verdict: A thin liner that also works well as a lightweight summer sleeping bag.
pros: Made from a soft fleece material that makes the inside of your sleeping bag comfortable
Unzips all the way around and can be laid flat
A very nice addition to your sleeping bag
cons: This product is made of polar fleece, which has a tendency to grab your clothes and can twist them while sleeping

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra warmth as a liner
customer_reviews.text: My son and I used these on a recent camping trip as liners in our sleeping bags. We were tenting in temps approximately upper 40s. These bags gave us both some welcome extra warmth. I don't think you'd want this alone at 50 deg but maybe around 70 deg it would be ok by itself. They pack down reasonably small, and while they aren't especially lightweight for backpacking, they fit our needs just fine for Cub Scout camp. The fabric is soft and warm just like your favorite throw blanket at home.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: It is a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This fleece sleeping bag liner is roomy enough for an old fat guy like me! It has a decent feel and soon after opening it and airing it out, any mild odor was gone. Just spray it with Frebreeze if it is too strong for you, or wash it and use a fabric softener sheet in the dryer. The zipper works easily, in fact, better than any on sleeping bags I have had. I wound up with the green one, and color is unimportant to me but wish they had shown all colors available on the listing. It makes a decent light weight blanket when completely unzipped, or for a throw on the couch to snuggle under.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: and this provided nice bedding lighter than a sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I lived in my car for a few months in the summer, and this provided nice bedding lighter than a sleeping bag. In the winter, it added extra insulation to make my sleeping bag warmer. Plus it acts as a sheet, which I can machine wash more often than I wash my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: John McGehee

customer_reviews.title: Love the zipper
customer_reviews.text: This liner is warm and soft. It doesn’t bunch up so you’re not sleeping on lumps of fabric. The best part is the zipper! Love the fact that it doesn’t snag. I got a Teton sleeping bag and their zippers are sooooo cheap. It will frustrate you right out of the box. Not this Coleman liner. It zips smoothly all around (except for the top). I am very happy with this purchase. The only complaint I have is that I can’t choose the color. It’s totally random. I got a green, which was nice, but I wished that I had a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: I found out temps would be dropping drastically just a few days before the camping trip I had already planned, so I Prime ordered this liner. The temp during the overnight camp-out had a low of 34F outside. The tent seemed to stave off some of the cold but I only had a lightweight Slumberjack Biker bag which I know would not be enough. This liner inside my Biker bag kept me absolutely comfortable and I know I would have been miserable (or worse) without it. This liner may be the best camping purchase I make this year.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Pace

customer_reviews.title: My first impression was not good...
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed my order of 4 of these for use as emergency blankets/hammock blankets for my family. So far I’m not too confident in my purchase. One of them came with crusty schmutz on the outside of the storage sleeve and another has a split seam on the storage bag which will make it unusable if it continues to separate. I unrolled one and they’re very thin, but soft. I like that they’re easy to repack by folding in thirds. The elastic band to hold it together is a smart touch when shimmying it back into the storage bag. The zippers seem really heavy duty. Too bad the first impression was off!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Behrens

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Cozy, warm, extra sized. Used on camping trip last week. Only thing, and I should have known...because it's polar fleece, don't wear polar fleece or else they stick together and you can't slide in or around very easy. After that night I slept in cotton or polyester blend and I could move just fine. It definitely kept me warmer than I expected. Would buy again and highly recommend, especially for us girls that are always cold.
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: Dual purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these concerned about the night time temps on a 7 night tent camping trip in the mountains. Zipped two together to line our double sleeping bag and it worked out great. Also got to use it as a standalone summer sleeping bag after leaving the mountains. Camped a few nights in N.M. with warmer temps and this was great when sleeping in the 60s. Easy to reroll though I'm not sure how long the attached straps will last. I can see them getting stretched out over time. They washed and dried safely.
customer_reviews.author: RaeLyn

customer_reviews.title: No Color Choice
customer_reviews.text: This bag liner is good quality and the zipper is good. I deducted a star because there is no color choice. What is the big deal about offering the customer a choice of color? I ended up with the green one which is my least favorite of the colors pictured. I’m keeping it because for my uses it’s not that big of a deal, but I think this is how they unload their least popular colors.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great Warm Weather Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a summer use sleeping bag. It’s for no colder than 50 degrees. I used this in my trailer during a warm couple evenings. Low of 70 degrees. Used it as a blanket but unzipping the whole bag. Thanks to the plow zipper it doesn’t snag. Kept me warm and comfortable. At this price it’s a great value. In the sleeping bag it’s so roomy. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I received one olive and one orange/rust. from my order of 2. I'm very happy with them! We will be putting these in our emergency packs in the car. I think they'll see a lot of use being pulled out for football games and outdoor evening activities. It's awesome that they unzip into a blanket. So yes, it's going in emergency kits, but these are going to see a lot of use. They are in a nice nice reusable sack. The sack has the blanket fabric and color on the bottom. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. CarriereTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Used as a liner to my double sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and zipped them together to be used as a liner on my double sleeping bag. Its a bit tricky, but to zip them together, simply zip the top zipper all the way down right against the bottom zipper and make sure both zippers are at the very bottom. You can then take the two sides apart. You can then use as a blanket, or make a double sleeping bag by matching up two bags and zipping them together. It was comfy and added insulation to my double sleeping bag for cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN Christian

customer_reviews.title: Camp Companion
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my winter setup for camping and it's been absolutely splendid. Packs down pretty well with an added compression bag I used an 8 liter one. It's also a nice campfire blanket that won't sting too much when you get an ember hole because these are so cheap. I used it as a liner to my sleeping bag and slept like a rock through a cold night. I had to unzip part of my bag because it got too warm. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H

customer_reviews.title: Nice blanket, nice zipper
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fleece blanket with a zipper. If it’s what you want, it’s what it is. I bought it to add some more temperature flexibility to my Coleman sleeping bag (which I’ve owned for 5-6 years with no issue of quality). Coleman is a household name because the stuff works. There’s aren’t a lot of moving parts here... a fleece blanket and a zipper. The blanket is a blanket and the zipper is smooth and double stitched like the one on my sleeping bag. Works great. I use it on my bed too. Why not?
customer_reviews.author: Devin711

customer_reviews.title: Big warmth in a little package
customer_reviews.text: These are just what we needed for cooler winter camping. My wife was complaining that her giant puffy sleeping bag wasn’t quite warm enough. Enter this liner. Adds a surprising amount of warmth and kept her warm during the freezing winter camp outs she does with Scouts. Now she can sleep comfortably without several layers of extra clothing. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Thinner than expected. Stuff sacks nice. No color choice.
customer_reviews.text: Size is fine, but these liners are very thin, so I don't think they will be as warm. They do come with a stuff sack which is good. You can't pick the color so that's disappointing. We were going to buy for whole family if pleased. As it is, we ordered for the kids and hopefully this thin layer will keep them warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Alert consumer

customer_reviews.title: Warm, snuggly, awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. We bought two. They made it through sub zero temps on our camping trip. Super easy to pack. So snuggly we’ve just continued using them at home, the kids drag them all over the house. One of our all time best Amazon buy for certain :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs_Web

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in Nepal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and I’s trip to Everest base camp. We already had down sleeping bags but I cannot stand being cold so I wanted an extra layer with me. I was not cold a SINGLE night and it got down into the teens. It was perfect because the first couple of nights were fairly warm and I could just use the liner as a light sleeping bag and skip the down. I also love that these completely unzip to a full size blanket! The only downside is that they are a little cumbersome and heavy so I wouldn’t take them on a backpacking trip, but for a big trip or car camping they’re great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed by the zipper design
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an extra layer for cold weather camping or by itself for the summer. It's about what it looks like, a blanket with a zipper. The zipper is a really good design. It has a red plastic piece which prevents anything from getting stuck in the zipper like my current sleeping bag. When I buy a new bag I'm going to look for one with a zipper like this liner has.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Olney

customer_reviews.title: Let us pick the color!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to travel with sometimes. I like to know I’m sleeping in my standard of clean. So for the fuss pot who wants a little clean cozy barrier to travel with- get one. Except I will say I wanted orange and got grey. BOOOOOOO!
customer_reviews.author: reading

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but warm
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit bulky but not a huge issue when car camping. We used these in our 30 degree bags and it made several 25 degree nights very comfortable (with the bag only, we got cold around 35). We also use these in the transition months when its too hot for a regular bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roth

customer_reviews.title: The orange looks great with my fushia sleeping bag too
customer_reviews.text: It was 28 degrees one night when camping, so in the middle of the night i put this in my sleeping bag and it kept me warm for the rest of the night. Totally worth the money. The orange looks great with my fushia sleeping bag too. Wish they made it for a mummy bag for a better fit, but it worked with mine just fine anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for summer car camping
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a summer beer festival camping trip in upstate NY and it was perfect. It seems very lightweight but it's surprisingly warm. The overnight low was in the mid-50s and I was perfectly comfortable. The only drawback is that you can't choose your color (at least when I ordered it). But I received the green one and I like it a lot. I would say it's an avocado green color, like a 70s living room carpet. It comes with a stuff sack, but it's hard to get it back in. This is definitely a car camping sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: E. Fahey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Nice liner. We have a tent camper. The bunk ends can get pretty cold. My wife is remarks on occasion about that fact. She said this liner made a world of difference when used with our budget sleeping bags. I know I enjoyed it the one night I got to use it. Writing this review as I order my next one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Does what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: First it came as orange, for those wondering on color. It seems to be will made and zipper is reliable. I sleep in a room that is normally between 62 and 76 degrees and it works fine. Cooler than that and you will want a second one or something thicker. Warmer and you won't want this unless it is breezy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Burton

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a camping trip to upper yosemite because I wasn't sure if my sleeping bag would stand up to freezing temps. It worked well and I could tell that without it I would probably have not been able to sleep in my bag unless I remained fully dressed with a jacket on.
customer_reviews.author: YD

customer_reviews.title: Good liner
customer_reviews.text: Good sleeping bag liner. Add to consider warmth to the sleeping bag. It is drawback drawback is the lack of space for your feet. It would’ve been much more comfortable if they had left some extra room at the bottom so you can sleep on your back with your feet pointing up.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, nice material. I bought it because even on a relatively mild night, if it drops to 50 F with a light sleeping bag, the cool air eventually seeps through my hammock and I'm cold. With a liner to create a layer against the bag it should help. My only issue is that, while compact, it's as large compact as my most compact sleeping bag and when every inch of space counts, it takes up too much room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great liner or bag!!
customer_reviews.text: This just works. I had a crazy idea, being a uhm "larger" person of a sleeping bag without the "bag". I got this, a sheet liner, and snugpak. This with the sheet liner so far works great to at least 60 with only shorts on. I also have to say I just love the zipper on this, it doesn't snag at all.
customer_reviews.author: RevSquishy

customer_reviews.title: Nice little fleece bag
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what it is. I used it more as a blanket than a sleeping bag. durable and the zippers never failed on me. would be a nice warm weather sleeping bag if you dont want to carry a larger bag. For under 20 bucks you could use it as a blanket for outdoor sporting events to stay warm and help cut down the wind if sitting in bleachers
customer_reviews.author: Eric U.

customer_reviews.title: nice, thick fleece
customer_reviews.text: this is a heck of a deal. Fairly heavy zipper does the foot and side, nice, thick fleece, plenty warm for a summer night all by itself. Doesn't seem cheap at all. Even the stuff sack is nicer than you'd expect for under $20, has a fleece bottom and mesh side panels, adjustable drawstring. Was a little wary about not being able to pick the color but it was a nice reddish orange, no problems there
customer_reviews.author: David Irland

customer_reviews.title: Zipper did not work AT ALL. Could not even open the bag.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived, I tried to unzip it, the zipper WOULD NOT MOVE AN INCH. Correction; not a millimeter. Even had another person try to pull it while I held the bag - nothing. I've never seen anything like it, it's like the zipper is welded in place. Extremely disappointing for a Coleman product, was forced to return it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: FordMandalay

customer_reviews.title: Wicked thin
customer_reviews.text: Very thin fleece, zipper is durable but so durable seems like the fleece will rip where it meets the fabric
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for a camping trip. Lightweight yet warm. Just enough for a cool summer night in the northeast. It can unzip to be used as a blanket or zipped in as a roomy sleeping bag. I can’t wait to take this on a backpacking trip. Compact and lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: RRW81

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tasker for all weather
customer_reviews.text: Definitely made our mummy bags extra warm and cozy for an early spring camping trip. That means we can camp earlier and later in the season and get more use out of the rest of our gear. It would be a good summer bag by itself, and has an attached elastic strap to make roll up easy and tidy. Also loved that you can zip two together to make a big sleeping bag or a shareable blanket for sitting outside when it’s chilly. We found this useful for sunsets & stargazing.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, warm, no snags. I feel like I picked a winner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this liner due to the soft warm feel of the fleece and the no-fuss zipper. This is an excellent accessory to my sleeping bag on cold nights and an adequate cover on its own on warm nights. There's no clinging or uncomfortable friction and it's big enough for me to stretch out or put my knees up in it. A nice item that does just what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Warm. Zippers don’t line up to zip together
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these to line our double sleeping bag for camping. They work well and are warm. All the zippers are different so they don’t line up well when zippered together. We ended up ordering 4 and kept the 2 where the zippers were most similar but they’re still about an inch off.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I'll be darned if this isn't a really great liner. My sleeping bag alone wasn't cutting it in the cold weather (35 degrees or lower). Got down to 22 degrees camping one trip and the liner partnered with my sleeping bag kept me toasty warm. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use scissors to remove the large tag do not tear it away!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this! We Backcountry camp and even in June and July it's below 40 at night in the mountains most nights. I have yet to use it but seems warm and durable. I only gave it 2 stars on durability bc when I went to remove the large tag it completely ripped at the seam. Now I have a hole about 2-3 inches wide at the zipper:( it will still work and I plan on using it in just a couple weeks, but was sad when it happened. Best advice use scissors to remove the tag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Raelle Rives

customer_reviews.title: Good Value in Sleeping Bag Liner
customer_reviews.text: This fleece liner kept me warm. And it fit into my vintage sleeping bag very nicely. A good value and a nice way to upgrade an old low thermal bag into a better one inexpensively.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One was green and one was orange. These were awesome! Used them for summer camp. They washed up well and were lightweight. Semi easy to get them back in the original package was able to get them back in after a little work.
customer_reviews.author: sean f mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and cozy addition to a camping experience
customer_reviews.text: I got this fleece sleeping bag to use as a fleece liner for my 40F North Face sleeping bag in case if I feel cold at night (as I am a warm sleeper). Did not sleep in it although it was warm enough (~55F) to sleep only in this fleece bag. I used this bag in the evening as a blanket, it made my camping experience way more cozy and comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great summer sleeping bag or winter liner bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice zipper. Nice fabric. I got 2. We call the first color "southwestern burnt orange" and the second color "kitty cat gray". Nice bags and good price. Could also use these as a liner to make my cold weather sleeping bag even warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Janny

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! - Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this as a liner for my sleeping bag in 20 degree weather, but I received this item damaged. There was a huge tear near the zipper which I didn't find out about until I was camping and using it for the first time. Poor quality control and poor workmanship. I expected Coleman to have good quality products, and I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: ... on a trek to EBC and it was a good send. Great for nights it was too warm ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a trek to EBC and it was a good send. Great for nights it was too warm for a sleeping bag, but also great for the coldest nights with my sleeping bag. Also I really liked that the bottom unzips so you can take your feet out if you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Quality, warmth and good comforts
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. Souls be a better opportunity of choosing your color I wanted the olive green but got bright green. Quality, warmth and comforter is as expected....
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Mendenhall

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and soft but will not KEEP YOU ALIVE when you need it most
customer_reviews.text: Only for summer cool nights. Used in the mountains it was bad decision by me. Not blaming product
customer_reviews.author: Steve Leffert

customer_reviews.title: ... a light blanket in warm weather and it gets pretty hot here in South Carolina
customer_reviews.text: I use this sleeping bag liner as a light blanket in warm weather and it gets pretty hot here in South Carolina, so a heavy blanket is not needed at night. The liner is made of a nice soft fleece that is both warm and comfortable. Would be a great asset to tenters who camp in warm weather and need something to just take the cool night air off. Comes with it's own carrying case and rolls up into a very small package. It's light weight and takes up very little room when stored.
customer_reviews.author: jjdcamper

customer_reviews.title: They felt very nice.
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman fleece sleeping bag liner felt great but I didn't get to try them out because the Camp Fire took them before I could use them. I bought 2 so I could zip them together.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: warm and versatile-- good product
customer_reviews.text: great product, helps stay warm inside a sleeping bag, or great to use on its own as a blanket. I thought I had ordered an orange one, but grey was delivered, not sure what happened there, but I am a bit disappointed on that aspect. Other than that though, it's great!! Two can be zippered together to fit a double sleeping bag, and it also has a double zipper so you can have the bottom open without opening the top.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Singh

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice thickness-not too heavy, not too thin. Feel like they will hold up, zipper flows fine. Have not used or washed yet, will update if any issues. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Whirling World

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Coleman sleeping bag for really cold nights or by itself during the summer.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a liner for my Coleman sleeping bag as it is much easier to wash and also it is great for use during the summer by itself. It seems to be of good quality as most of the Coleman products. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Capixaba

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Cold Weather Camping!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO glad I bought these before our winter camping trip. I have a cold weather sleeping bag but still end up shivering when I winter camp. This insert kept me nice and toasty! I bought one for each of my kids as well and neither of them complained about being cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm on a cold night
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a liner for my 30-degree bag. It is a rectangle liner while my bag is a mummy sack, but that is the fault of the purchaser, not the company. The liner is thick and comfortable, and the zipper is heavy-duty. It got to around 25 and I was never cold.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping in the South
customer_reviews.text: When you live in the South and are involved in Scouting, you ready do not need a heavy weight sleeping bag the majority of the time. Outside of August and Dec-Feb, I've found this to be the perfect weight sleeping bag. Lightweight, breathes well, rolls up tight and easy to clean (just toss in the washing machine).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Comer

customer_reviews.title: Great summer bag on its own.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to be a summer sleeping bag not as a liner. I don't like to take my expensive winter bag during the summer. It worked great down to about 50 degrees. Would definitely but again. Probably to bulky for backpacking but would be great for summer car or canoe camping.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: I might buy another.
customer_reviews.text: I am using the blanket for camping. It's as soft as a stuffed animal. 40-50 degrees in a tent fully dressed I was as comfortable as suspected. Zipper handle appears to be of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Black Hat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice and soft but doesn't snag on everything like I thought it might. I used mine for sleeping outdoors in the summer and found it was perfect - fall asleep on top of it as a soft (thin) pad when it's still warm out, then climb inside when it gets cooler and it provides just the right weight to be comfortable. Seems to breathe well too, so no condensation like a nylon bag.
customer_reviews.author: N. Vollrath

customer_reviews.title: Winter camping necessity!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a necessity for my son to winter camp with scouts in comfort. Prior polar bear campout was single digit temps during a snow/sleet winter storm. His mummy bag needed a liner so I quickly purchased for next campout two weeks later. He said he was comfortable all night, slept well! Plan to purchase one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Took this thing backpacking in February (temps in low 20's) to put inside my cheap coleman sleeping bag (10 degree bag, which really means 40 degrees lol). It did add some warmth to the bag, will definitely get more use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 3 of these now. They're perfect for warm summer camping - very lightweight and comfortable. They're also great for medical residents on call in the hospital. I always bring this on night shifts in case I get a chance to retreat to the call room and take a nap - much more comfortable than standard hospital bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: A great addition
customer_reviews.text: Got this for fall camping for extra warmth. It definitely adds comfort inside your sleeping bag. I also open it up and use it as a blanket. Washes very well and packs up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable layer of warmth!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blanket! I live in Colorado so I need extra warmth when camping. Since I don't have a really good sleeping bag, this really did the job adding a extra layer of warmth. It is also soft and comfortable. The size is perfect and the anti snag zipper is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: What we needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a backpacking trip with my daughter. They gave a little extra warmth and kept the insides of the sleeping bags clean. A little bulky. Turn inside out to wash so the over-sized zipper does not clatter in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely buy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two. We love them. Have used them all summer to camp. They are a wonderful buy and soooo comfortable to sleep in! We camped May through September (coming up), and in those slightly cooler months we did/plan to bring a blanket to put over these if it gets below 60 at night!
customer_reviews.author: Hayley M.

customer_reviews.title: Clean sleeping.
customer_reviews.text: This is great to take with you if you are planning to crash on someone's couch for the night and aren't sure what the bedding situation will be - like if the couch is covered in dog hair or not. It rolls up to about a quarter the size of a standard sleeping bag, so while it isn't huge it isn't tiny either. It does provide the amount of warmth you would expect from a fleece blanket, so if it's going to be cold you will want to plan for a few extra layers, but it should be fine for sleeping indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E.

customer_reviews.title: not quite warm down to 50 degrees.
customer_reviews.text: I took this camping in the boundary waters when the forecast showed consistent evening temps in the low to mid 50s but this did not hold up to the 50 degree weather promise. I froze pretty good two of the nights and I'm a big guy who is normally incredibly warm. I think there is still good application for these bags in a true summer camping situation with nights in the 60s or 70s, but I wouldn't rely on 50 degree nights unless you are going to really bundle up. I will say, it does pack incredibly small, much smaller than my colder weather bag so that was a plus for trying to pack light.
customer_reviews.author: Blake A Kloeckner

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: If you’re in the military, or simply like camping buy this thing. I’m 6’7 so it’s a tad small for me but it makes the sleeping bag wayyy warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kent McLay

customer_reviews.title: Summer Camping
customer_reviews.text: My son the boy scout will use this a sleeping bag during the spring, summer and fall as it doesn't get real cold here...it's like sleeping in your favorite fleece jacket...
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Finally!! Able to sleep in warmth!!
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my daughter who loves ves to sleep outside on the covered deck all year- no matter the weather. Even with a very good bag, she would still need more warmth. And out under the stars was too chilly. We live at a high elevation. I gave her one of these liners to try. She LOVES it. It made a big difference. We love the thermal properties of fleece in general. The deck temps only got to the 40's and we haven't SLEPT OUTSIDE up on the mountains yet. This is a very good start.
customer_reviews.author: Z'Oma

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly for that but it isn't the best quality. The zipper ripped out the first week ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Red Cross volunteer and I take this with me to use on the cots to sleep. It works perfectly for that but it isn't the best quality. The zipper ripped out the first week I used it but I like this concept.
customer_reviews.author: Xandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice sleeping bag for travel, when stay in the hotel, than sleep in the hotel bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Cuan Boutot

customer_reviews.title: Added 12 degrees to my bag!
customer_reviews.text: Eliminated deadspots and added 12 degrees to my bag, think of it as a sock for your sleeping bag. You wouldn't wear shoes without socks now would you?
customer_reviews.author: Minhsane

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Updated. Much thinner fleece than I thought, but effective. Zipper jammed the 2nd month I had it, then broke. I do really like that it unzips completely to form a larger cover, it's durable and easy to clean and rolls up very small. All very good attributes. Aside from temperature regulation, I like to use it as a liner inside my sleeping bag to keep me from sweating due to the synthetic fabric of my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: These are shockingly good bags, particularly for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are shockingly good bags, particularly for the price. They're warm but not too warm, comfortable, packable, washable, unzip fully into a blanket, unzip from either end to make a hole for your feet so you can walk while in it, etc. Get two and they zip together. Basically just a big sheet of fleece with a zipper, which turns out to be a pretty great thing to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Well made and warm. You can use by its self for warmer months or as an inside liner for your sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Naasi

customer_reviews.title: Got me through 6 days of hiking up Kilimanjaro!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a cheap 32-75 degree sleeping bag on amazon which I really liked. But going to a Kilimanjaro I know I needed something warmer. This fleece liner was the perfect answer! It kept me nice and warm every night, even on summit night when it was below freezing at midnight! Would highly recommend if your sleeping bag isn’t cutting it!
customer_reviews.author: Don John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is a warm sleeper so I bought this for his first camp out with us this summer. It is very light but warm enough that with his pajamas and this on a foam cushion he was plenty warm. I also will use it for our ladies retreats when we are in indoor cabins that are too warm for regular sleeping bags. I also appreciate that this can just be tossed into the washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen H. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Summer in Maryland
customer_reviews.text: Going to use this next week on the Appalachian Trail in Maryland. Hope it will keep me warm along with my sleeping pad in my hammock. Will update when I get back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Coleman sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I got grayish green. The quality of fabric and the zipper looks great. Lightweight just what I need. Used it alone when the temperature was above 65 Fahrenheit. Below 65, I would need a blanket on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: YU-KAI CHIOU

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my kids and my niece to use at Grandma and Grandpa's house. They sleep on camp cots while we're there and I thought these would be fun indoor sleeping bags. The fleece is a great color and texture however, it stuck to the kids and made them really uncomfortable. They complained about it within the first 10 minutes. We ended up wrapping the bags in sheets and using them for cushions on the camp cots.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Bang for buck for a warm weather sleeping bag, this is great. More comfortable than cheap plastic feeling bags. Pack down smaller too. I brought them tent camping in the desert Southwest.
customer_reviews.author: Plekky

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. I have yet to see how the zipper holds out. Nice soft fleece! I notice that the liner came with a warranty which is great because I have had issues with zippers in bags and liners.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Elyse

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product so that you don't have to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: This item will improve the cold weather rating on any of your sleeping bags just put it inside your bag. It will help keep you warm and dry. I recommend this product so that you don't have to purchase a new cold weather bag. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Used as sleeping bag liner, let me choose colors!
customer_reviews.text: Great as a sleeping bag liner, they will keep you about 10 degrees warmer, also used on top of a queen inflatable mattress. The only con is that color can not be chosen, I bought 3, got 2 green and one blue....wanted all orange.
customer_reviews.author: lifeisgood

customer_reviews.title: Great added layer of warmth
customer_reviews.text: Soft and warm, plus the zipper is very smooth. This was a great addition for our family "car camping" trip as it made our cheap, $20 sleeping bags feel like they cost over $100. For backpacking, this is would be too much extra weight, but for our purposes, it was great.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than I expected!  Dries quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how fast this thing dries! I dropped it in a puddle, tied it to my backpack and kept going. I had not secured it correctly, my failure not the product's. It was dry by the time I made camp, and that was with it balled up and not in direct sunlight. On several nights I have had to unzip the bag because it's so warm. This is my new favorite sleeping bag and yes I know it's only supposed to be a liner but it works fine on its own!
customer_reviews.author: Donny Brassco

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Warm. But not as warm as I expected. Have a very similar fleece liner that I bought at least a decade ago and was expecting it to be as warm as that one. If you have nothing else to compare it to, it's a great fleece liner.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie R

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Coleman Product
customer_reviews.text: Coleman Overall is a decent company trying to bring budget to the consumers. I think this fleece is a decent attempt for the price if you want a fleece with a zipper that is. If you want a Liner without a zipper they make that too as well an they pack up smaller. This however is not overly heavy at all. light duty but warm might add 10-15 degrees warmth in your bag who knows will update when Camp tested, only used it at home so far. Included Drawstring stuff sack with breathable mesh perforation Strip. Buyer beware color is random from here but i knew this an ended up with grey ;-].
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our son prior to his attendance at the 2013 National Boy Scout Jamboree in West Virginia. We were looking for something that packed small, and would be neither too hot nor too light for the summer weather. He slept comfortably at the Jamboree and we took it on a camping trip after he returned home. After four machine washings, it still looks and works great. He will take this with him and use as a liner in his mummy bag for winter camping in January. Would love to get a couple more of these when the budget allows. (we got the rust color)
customer_reviews.author: K Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RV
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for use in our motor home. Pack small and not too warm. RV has heat so just need light warmth.
customer_reviews.author: DBRob

customer_reviews.title: good for warm climate camping
customer_reviews.text: The zipper is a problem. The dual zipper system is apparently not intuitive. Twice I have had people using the bag end up with the zipper jammed and broken. I like the bag, it is perfect for warm climate camping here in Florida, but I need somethning that does not require instructions to use.
customer_reviews.author: Atsenaotie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one since I loved it so much. So warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: recommended, I'll buy another
customer_reviews.text: I've been testing this out at home. Ben slept in over 14 times and washed three times, no trouble. After I use it over a sleeping bag liner and inside a bivy I expect to buy another. It's just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: 4paws-a- walkn'

customer_reviews.title: Be blanket arrived on time for my Sons scout camp ...
customer_reviews.text: The blanket/ lined arrived on time for my Sons scout camp out. It was a welcomed Addition to the sleeping bag. The temps were in the 30s and it helped a lot. The blanket we received was grey, not orange as shown. So if you are going to be disappointed, like my son was, thatbit isn’t orange I would not order from here.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Marie

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I bought 2 for a camping trip and I am so glad that I did because without them we would have been too cold. they even zip into our sleeping bags fairly easily. definately worthe the 14 dollars I paid for them. I hightly recommend them for all sorts of stuff from camping to stashing in the car in the winter time because they are warm and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M.

customer_reviews.title: I bought two for use as sleeping bag liners. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for use as sleeping bag liners. Temperatures dropped below 50 at night and these liners made all the difference. At first we used them as blankets over our sleeping bags, but we were so cold that finally we put them inside our sleeping bags, as they are intended, and that made a huge difference. I only wish they had sent me 2 different colors, rather than 2 of the same color, to help distinguish them.
customer_reviews.author: TTCulligan

customer_reviews.title: Makes camping enjoyable!
customer_reviews.text: This liner makes camping much more enjoyable for me. I can use it as a light blanket if it is warm outside or i can add it to my cheap sleeping bag when it is cold outside. It is also easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Hippogirl

customer_reviews.title: These were the perfect addition to our cold
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect addition to our cold, mountain camping trips! We love that they zip together so that we can put them inside our regular Coleman sleeping bags and stay warm. It lets my husband have the one thin fleece layer, but I can have both the fleece and the sleeping bag. I also love how small they roll up, so we don't have to make extra room when we're packing.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: This is the best! If you want to byob bring your own ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! If you want to byob bring your own blanket this is the one for you. Its the perfect cuddle buddy, the material feels wonderful an breathable. It is compact and travels well. If you are considering purchasing my vote is GO FOR IT
customer_reviews.author: KiBROWS

product_meta.title: Coleman Stratus Adult Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner, Mixed Colors
product_meta.description:
Color:Mixed ColorsThe Coleman Stratus Adult Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner doubles as both a warm, cozy liner and a low-profile sleeping bag. On its own, the liner can keep you warm in temperatures as low as 50 degrees Fahrenheit. When placed inside another sleeping bag, it can provide 12 degrees Fahrenheit of extra thermal protection. This low-profile sleeping bag liner features a two-way patented ZipPlow zipper system that plows fabric away from the zipper to prevent snags and frustration. It also features an elastic storage strap and stuff sack for easy packing and transport. The Stratus Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner can accommodate most people up to 5 feet 11 inches in height. It is machine washable for easy cleaning.

AMAZON.COM
The Coleman 8197C410 Stratus Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner is the perfect accompaniment to any sleeping bag, especially when you are camping where you are not sure how cold it is going to be. This sleeping-bag liner is full-size, measuring 33-inches by 75-inches, and fits most full-size sleeping bags up to 5-feet 11-inches long. When used with a sleeping bag, this liner adds 12 degrees of thermal protection, making a 35-degree sleeping bag usable at temperatures as low as 23 degrees! The Coleman fleece sleeping-bag liner is commercial-machine-washable only and comes with its own stuff sack.

 Manufacturer Warranty
Five-year warranty
feature_bullets: Versatile, low-profile fleece sleeping bag liner provides warmth and comfort
Can be used on its own to keep you comfortable in temperatures as low as 50 degrees Fahrenheit
Adds up to 12 degrees F of extra thermal protection to most full-sized sleeping bags
ZipPlow system plows away fabric to prevent snagging during zipping
Elastic storage strap and stuff sack for easy packing

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
